app.word: Events, Conditions, and Actions Definition Groups
Global Arguments and Object Conversion Mapping

The data key can only be lowercase alphanumerics (including underscores).
It is used to access this data from the host object. Example: $value = $object->getRulesData( 'key' );
Note: If you change this key, rules that use this data will still work.
However, any token replacements or custom code which use the changed key will break.
Public access will allow the field to be edited by any member with permission. Administrative access limits editing of the field to moderators with permission to edit the item.
Enter the name of the tab that this field should appear under on editing forms
This key is already being used for another field
Your data key contains invalid characters. Only lowercase alphanumerics (including underscores) are allowed.
If you select a bulk process argument, this action will be run repeatedly until every associated record in the system has been used as the argument.
Bulk processing is processed in batches so that large runs can be handled reliably.
You can type the names of tokens (include the brackets) into text entry fields on this form and they will be replaced by their associated data when the rule is executed.

The machine name can only be lowercase alphanumerics (including underscores). It needs to be unique to this action and will used as a variable name in action code.
( ex: member )

Select whether your action will require this argument
Describe what this action argument is for. (ex: Member to send the email to )
This machine name is already being used in this action
This machine name contains invalid characters. Only lowercase alphanumerics (including underscores) are allowed.
Independent Rule (not part of a rule set)

Actions that are executed immediately can affect the conditions of other rules operating on the same event. In some cases this is desirable, but is generally not recommended as it can lead to unexpected rule results.
At the end of the event (recommended)
Fixed amount of time in the future
A specific date in the future

• object: An \IPS\DateTime Object
  • int: A unix timestamp
  • string: A date/time string

Optional. Only one action will remain scheduled for any given keyphrase at a time. If an action is rescheduled, any previously scheduled actions with the same keyphrase will be removed.
Note: Token replacements can be used in your keyphrase.
Warning: PHP is for advanced users only. Your php code needs to return a value to use as the argument. Do not include a <?php tag at the beginning of your code, or comment it out if you do.
The operation expects you to return one of the following argument types:
The following variables are available to your php code:
If the event data for this argument is empty, an alternative value can be used.
If enabled, information related to this rule will be logged in the debug console.

You can choose how you want the base conditions for this rule to be evaluated.
  • If you choose AND, all base conditions must be valid for actions to be executed.
  • If you choose OR, actions will be executed if any base condition is valid.

Since this condition has subconditions, you must choose how you want those subconditions to affect the state of this condition.
  • If you choose AND, this condition and all subconditions must be true for this condition to be valid.
  • If you choose OR, this condition will pass if it is valid, or if any subcondition is valid.
Using NOT will reverse the condition result so that the result is TRUE if the condition is NOT MET.

The event has indicated that this data may sometimes be empty. The good news is that this argument is optional for the operation. However, you may still provide an alternative value to use in case it is not provided by the event.

The event has indicated that this data may sometimes be empty. This argument is REQUIRED for the operation to work. If you do not provide an alternative value, this operation will be skipped if the event data is missing.
This rule was designed for an event that cannot currently be triggered on your system. Configuration is disabled.

Any groups selected here will be added to the members secondary groups, preserving any existing secondary groups they may be assigned to.
Member To Remove Secondary Groups From
Any groups selected here will be removed from the members secondary groups, preserving any other secondary groups they may be assigned to.
Member To Set Secondary Groups For
Any groups selected here will become the only secondary groups assigned to the member.
